definition: to drive a car

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
surname Che
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
driver/person driving a vehicle
motorists

sentences.english: Eventually, a man drove us in his own car to safety.
sentences.chinese: 最后，一名男子开车把我们载到安全之地。

sentences.english: My father always picks me up after school.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲常开车顺便接我。

sentences.english: Laureen approves her husband's political views and once canvassed for him.
sentences.chinese: 她赞同丈夫的政治观点，并亲自开车上阵为丈夫助选。

sentences.english: Especially in the United States, it's a law that you have to wear your seatbelt.
sentences.chinese: 尤其在美国，法律规定开车时必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: You can reduce your output by avoiding aerosols and driving less, for starters.
sentences.chinese: 你可以通过避用气雾剂或少开车来减少起动机的排气。

sentences.english: In England people drive on the left.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，人们开车靠左行驶。

sentences.english: I drove home with the dog on the front seat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 我开车带小狗回家，它就坐在我旁边的位置上。

sentences.english: (against) Using a cell phone while driving is against the traffic rules.
sentences.chinese: 边开车边打手机是违反交通规则的。

sentences.english: I'll be glad to drive you out to Narita when you go to L. A.
sentences.chinese: 你去洛杉矶的时候，我很愿意开车送你去成田机场。

sentences.english: The railway timetable shows the time when the trains arrive and depart.
sentences.chinese: 列车时刻表告诉人们火车到站和开车的时间。

sentences.english: He was told that a council officer had reason to believe he was "dripping his cigarette" while driving his car.
sentences.chinese: 他被告知政府有理由相信他在开车期间“乱弹烟蒂”。

sentences.english: I'm driving collectively a country roadvertising oned I'm completely lost.
sentences.chinese: 我开车顺着一条乡下小路前行，我一经全体迷路了。

sentences.english: In Topeka , Kansas, it is illegal to drive ones car through a parade.
sentences.chinese: 在堪萨斯州的托皮卡，开车穿过游行队伍也是违法的。

sentences.english: Don't forget belt up before you drive off.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了开车前系好保险带。

sentences.english: Today, I was driving to work and I had to pee really badly.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我开车去上班，有点内急。

definition: to drive a vehicle
chauffeur/driver/CL:個|个[ge4]
to take the car, bus, train etc
to cycle
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
driver/person driving a vehicle
to pilot (ship, airplane etc)/to drive
to change lanes
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
